post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, September 21
post.Content:
More links for everyone to enjoy!

  • If you are going to JavaOne this year and are a member of the Java desktop community,  you should sign up for my sixth annual Java Desktop Lunch! Space is running out and people who are not registered will not be able to attend. Get in quick.
  • Dirk Lemmermann has another interview this week, this time with Mint Software Systems.
  • Hendrik Ebbers has being playing around with layered images this week, creating some cool 3D effects influenced by the latest Apple TV UI designs. It is very neat, and I love the Star Wars surprise :-)
  • Tom Eugelink is posting his 'JFXtras: lessons learned developing in JavaFX' slide deck online for all to read. Very useful!
  • Steven Schwenke has posted material from a course he gave to his colleagues on JavaFX.
  • Amrullah Syadzili has posted about how DetachableTabPane now supports docking and reordering.
  • Gluon did a blog post about the release of the CharmListView control, which is a part of Gluon Charm. This control provides a more 'mobile-friendly' ListView API compared to the standard JavaFX ListView.

That's all for this week - catch you again next week :-)
